data.title: Add get_points() method to AStar
data.body:
Adds the get_points() method to AStar, which will return an Array of the indexes of all points. 
This is not strictly necessary, but i can imagine a lot of cases in which this could be helpful,
As of now there no way to get a list of all points.

data.title: Game force closed "shit?: No such file or directory"
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 7 64-bit. Godot 2.1.4

**Issue description:**
I was running my game through the editor when the game forced closed and the following was displayed in the editor.

```
shit?: No such file or directory
ERROR: StreamPeerWinsock::read: Sesrhvietr? di:s conInnevcatleidd!
r
ume n t At
 plaEtRfoRrOmR\:w iSntdorwesa\msPtereeraWmi_pneseorc_kw:i:nrseoacdk:. cpp:S2e0r2
v
r disconnected!

   At: platform\windows\stream_peer_winsock.cpp:202
```
I have no idea what it means. I haven't altered the format of the output.

**Steps to reproduce:**
I haven't been able to reproduce it but I was having issues with my wifi at the time. As there appears to be some sort of connection issue, perhaps it is related.

I was running my game through the editor while windows was troubleshooting the problems with my wifi in the background. The game might have closed when the network adapter was resetting.

data.title: Modify inertia implementation for freelook and orbit
data.body: This is a solution for the topics discussed in: #10994 #10667 #10994 gets superseded by this one too since I needed the settings to do effective testing. @kubecz3k I hope you are okay with that. otherwise we could ask @akien-mga to merge your pr first and than I rebase and adapt it. The only real issue that gets fixed though is: - inertia calculation was frame rate dependant. (now it feels about the same) - The comment @reduz mention in this commit message 8951403 (this inertia implementation works in orthogonal too) ## Changes: - freelook now uses position based inertia (holding a key for a specific time always rults in the same distance traveled independent of inertia setting) - orbit inertia now is angle bases. (not transformation based) -> camera always takes the same path. - added setting for orbit inertia - added setting hints for freelook settings. ### orbit inertia now is angle bases. (not transformation based) -> camera always takes the same path. In this video (https://youtu.be/e85LIZTGEns) it is really good to see how the old transform dependant orbit interpolation affected the camera path. the camera gets closer to the rotation centre with high inertia and fast inputs. Now the path will always be the same, just the movement will be smooth this image illustrates how the inertia did affect ("current Movement") the camera path. and how the movement will be with this pr ("Movement when the angle is interpolated") but still If you refer the old behaviour (like shown in the video) than we need another pr I guess.

data.title: Translation snapping should have individual settings for the x, y and z axes
data.body:
Humans are not cubes, we are tall and thin. We made our hallways tall, our doorways tall, the houses we live in, and the closets we hang our clothes in.
The editor's translation snap however assumes that the entire world is made of uniformly-sized cubes. (or squares, in case of the 2D editor)

I would enjoy the ability to work on a different y-level without having to fiddle with the snap settings every time i want to go back down a level.

data.title: Editing a project always opens the 3D view at first, even if there are no 3D nodes in the default scene
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):** Windows 10, Godot Git https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/5f0d367fef25b30742ba71f12e339137e02c59ab


**Issue description:** Opening a project (in my case, I'm working on a Godot console, which only uses 2D nodes) will always open the 3D view in the editor, even if the project doesn't use any 3D nodes. In 2.1.4, the 2D view is opened if the project's default scene does not contain any 3D nodes, which is a more logical behavior.


**Steps to reproduce:** Open a 2D-only project in a 3.0 development build.

data.title: Fix using enum as bool value
data.body:
This warning actually hid a bug. The value of ERR_INVALID_DATA is
actually 30, returning this as a bool returns true while false was
required.

data.title: Crash when create/load project.
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 10 x64 build from 06.09.2017

**Issue description:**
When in project manager create new project windows says that program crashes but editor work fine, and project manager still visible. Its looks like project start twice.
![error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6241034/30153859-abeefbea-93c0-11e7-983e-cfce5edef70e.png)

data.title: "Find next" shortcut in code editor not  working now that F3 is also used to "Open 3D editor
data.body:
**Issue description:**
After the reorganization of the F-Keys shortcuts in godot 2.1.4, F3 for "find next" in code editor doesn't work. Seems like "Open 3D Editor" has priority over it.
When F3 used to open the code editor, "find next" worked fine.

edit: 

Yes you can change the shortcuts, but since F3 is kinda like the "universal" shortcut to "find next" (if we're not talking about vim and other terminal exclusive editors), this seems counter-intuitive.

data.title: Fix serveral recent new clang-format errors
Fix warnings comparing enums of different types
data.body:
This fixes a source of many compiler warnings regarding comparing the
enum VARIANT_TYPE to Variant::Type. This changes the local value to a
static const Variant::Type value rather than an unrelated enum, this
also saves us a cast.

(This removes 215 warnings from the build)

data.title: Shader Language 3.0: built-ins question
data.body:
i'm talking about spatial type vertex shaders here.
there are declared built-ins such as SRC_VERTEX, POSITION, etc. but when i try to read them in the shader, it draws white circle, meaning something went wrong. and i failed to find any usage of those variables in source code (but i'm not very good in c++ tho), so i assume either there is a bug, or they are outputs, but SRC_ means input, right?

and i don't understand in which space VERTEX built-in is. is it camera space or world or may be even model?

i was trying to implement (and last attempts were actually to use working implementations) of atmospheric scattering, and i need to use different positions and directions there, and it always fails (even with working code) drawing pitch black, so i assumed i'm using some vectors in wrong way, because i don't understand what they mean in godot ðŸ™„

data.title: Give the option to clear recent scenes like in the Scrip Editor
data.body: The Script Editor has the option to clear the list of recent scripts. Such option would also be appreciated for the list of recent scenes.

data.title: The editor is less responsive when set to "update only changes"
data.body:
Godot 3.0 master, also 2.1.3
Windows 10 64 bits

I don't know wether this is fixable or not, but on Windows I always noticed a slightly better response time / better framerate when "update always" was checked on top-right. To the point I always checked it when taking videos. Now I see the option is going to be deprecated and default to "update changes", which finally convinced me to open this issue for the record.

I noticed this in many situations, for example scrolling the script editor, and took a video of it to show the difference: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/10489#issuecomment-325166871

~~@toger5 didn't experience this on Mac, so it might be OS-specific.~~

I just tried to record a video of it in the 3D viewport but I was unable to make the difference stand out much with OBS, because on my laptop it slows down FPS just enough, which is frustrating...
I retried with tweaked settings: http://zylannprods.fr/dl/godot/subtle_framerate_difference.mp4
(but the most measurable example is the script editor).

It feels like the editor reacts and redraws at 40..50 fps / drops frames, instead of 60 when I set "update changes", which is subtle, but noticeable.
Edit: it's also easily seen when resizing docks.

data.title: Change Color.to_32() to Color.to_rgba32() and lowercase other functions
data.body:
Both functions Color.to_32() and Color.ARGB32() results exactly same data, even the code internally are nearly identical.

Since there's already a function for ARGB format (Color.to_ARGB32()), Color.to_32() is formatted as RGBA.

data.title: Fix EOF in wav file importer
data.body:
In #10973 I reset the state of the stream in get_pos() assuming that the
ftell failing would cause proper error checking. This is not how this
class was designed, however. This commit fixes the get_8() method to
not return unitialized data on eof, and removes the wrong error resets
added in #10973.

This fixes #11022

data.title: Remove assignment and declarations in if statements
data.body:
After discussing with @reduz and @akien-mga it was decided that we do
not allow assignments or declarations in if statements. This PR removes
the instances of this I could find by automated means.

data.title: Editor freeze on importing wav file
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Arch linux, master branch

**Issue description:**
If you add some *.wav file to project, engine will reimport it. And stops on it. Only killing of the process can help.

In debug I see, that it take Segmentation fault exception in object.cpp in _predelete() method because of "this" is NULL.
Stacktrace:
Object::_predelete object.cpp:384 at
predelete_handler object.cpp:1774 at
memdelete<GDNativeSingletonDiscover> memory.h:107 at
unregister_gdnative_types register_types.cpp:252 at
unregister_module_types register_module_types.gen.cpp:147 at
Main::cleanup cami.cpp:1714 at
main godot_x11.cpp:55

I think. that something in process of importing wav file brake the engine and it tries to finish process.
